column4: looks like it worked, though I had to restart since I was getting symbol errors when I attempted to modprobe
modinfo iwl4945, i think the one in ubuntu is 1.2.25
also if u havent already done so install linux-backports
it has updated wifi stack
backports is pretty stable for me on 2.6.24-19 kernel
im on 2.6.25.10, is backports a package in apt?
2.6.25? are u on intrepid?
no I manually upgraded (tinkering with iwlwifi required it)
so im hardy
hm forget about backports then its for stock kernel only
but this is fine now, for some reason I kept getting kernel panics with that other module I compiled, and they increased in frequency over time
yep same problem for me here panics with the newer kernel
also heavy cpu usage when connecting to networks to the point where computer becomes unusable
many ppl report that
Im not sure if its the newer kernel or that specific wifi module, because if I used the machine with networking disabled it never paniced
i suggest go back to hardy stock kernel 2.6.24-19 and install backports module
backports is 1.2.25 and as i said its been stable for me
I still have that kernel, I'd just have to go back and reconfigure my xorg.conf
but i'll see if this gives me anymore trouble first
the whole thing has been nothing but trouble to me, iwl driver is half baked with stuff like dynamic wep missing so i cant connect to my college's wifi
your college uses encryption on the wifi network? :/
yea
